title: 2023 Indian Challenger RR King of the Baggers Replica
description: This 2023 Indian Challenger RR King of the Baggers replica is number 7 of 29 examples built through a collaboration between Indian and S&S Cycle to commemorate Indian's MotoAmerica King of the Baggers race series championship in 2022. This example is powered by a liquid-cooled PowerPlus 60-degree 112ci V-twin paired with a six-speed transmission, and is finished in black with white, red and gold graphics over a cast aluminum frame. Equipment includes a S&S air intake system with a 78mm single bore throttle body, a fully adjustable Maxx Sport ECU, an adjustable Öhlins inverted 43mm fork, an adjustable Öhlins shock in the rear as well as an S&S two-into-one exhaust system, carbon-fiber saddlebags, a Saddlemen race seat, and a fiberglass rear fender. This Challenger RR King of the Baggers replica is offered in Pennsylvania by the selling dealer for off-road or display purposes only with a manufacturer's certificate of origin.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 2023 Indian Challenger RR King of the Baggers Replica at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #176,881.
text: This 2023 Indian Challenger RR King of the Baggers replica is number 7 of 29 examples built through a collaboration between Indian and S&S Cycle to commemorate Indian’s MotoAmerica King of the Baggers race series championship in 2022. This example is powered by a liquid-cooled PowerPlus 60-degree 112ci V-twin paired with a six-speed transmission, and is finished in black with white, red and gold graphics over a cast aluminum frame. Equipment includes a S&S air intake system with a 78mm single bore throttle body, a fully adjustable Maxx Sport ECU, an adjustable Öhlins inverted 43mm fork, an adjustable Öhlins shock in the rear as well as an S&S two-into-one exhaust system, carbon-fiber saddlebags, a Saddlemen race seat, and a fiberglass rear fender. This Challenger RR King of the Baggers replica is offered in Pennsylvania by the selling dealer for off-road or display purposes only with a manufacturer’s certificate of origin. The MotoAmerica King of the Baggers Replica was offered to the public through Indian dealerships, and this example is finished in black with white, red, and gold accents along with racing decals. It features a fiberglass rear fender, a raised Saddlemen race seat, carbon-fiber saddlebags, a cast aluminum frame, a front fairing, a belly pan, a aero windscreen, and rear-set foot controls. Forged aluminum 17″ wheels are finished in black and mounted with 120/70 front and 200/60 rear Dunlop Sportmax Q5 tires. Braking is provided by a pair of 330mm drilled rotors with radially mounted Brembo Monobloc four-piston calipers up front as well as a single 300mm drilled disc with a Hayes two-piston caliper at the rear. Front suspension consists of a fully adjustable Öhlins FGR250 inverted 43mm fork while the rear is equipped with a fully adjustable Öhlins monoshock and an aluminum swingarm. A one-piece handlebar is secured above adjustable billet aluminum triple clamps, while an AIM DL2 data logger positioned just ahead has indicators for oil pressure, engine temperature, and battery amperage as well as a GPS system and lap timers. The data logger shows one test lap that was completed by S&S Cycle however, the bike was not equipped with an odometer, therefore total mileage is unknown. The liquid-cooled PowerPlus 60-degree 112ci V-twin features an adjustable Maxx Sport ECU, an S&S air intake system, electronic fuel injection with a 78mm throttle body, S&S camshafts, as well as an S&S two-into-one exhaust system. Power is sent to the rear wheel through a multi-plate wet clutch, a six-speed transmission, and a drive chain. The bike does not have a title or registration and is being sold on a manufacturer’s certificate of origin. You are not connected to real-time updates. Attempting to connect. html:
This 2023 Indian Challenger RR King of the Baggers replica is number 7 of 29 examples built through a collaboration between Indian and S&S Cycle to commemorate Indian’s MotoAmerica King of the Baggers race series championship in 2022. This example is powered by a liquid-cooled PowerPlus 60-degree 112ci V-twin paired with a six-speed transmission, and is finished in black with white, red and gold graphics over a cast aluminum frame. Equipment includes a S&S air intake system with a 78mm single bore throttle body, a fully adjustable Maxx Sport ECU, an adjustable Öhlins inverted 43mm fork, an adjustable Öhlins shock in the rear as well as an S&S two-into-one exhaust system, carbon-fiber saddlebags, a Saddlemen race seat, and a fiberglass rear fender. This Challenger RR King of the Baggers replica is offered in Pennsylvania by the selling dealer for off-road or display purposes only with a manufacturer’s certificate of origin.

The MotoAmerica King of the Baggers Replica was offered to the public through Indian dealerships, and this example is finished in black with white, red, and gold accents along with racing decals. It features a fiberglass rear fender, a raised Saddlemen race seat, carbon-fiber saddlebags, a cast aluminum frame, a front fairing, a belly pan, a aero windscreen, and rear-set foot controls.

Forged aluminum 17″ wheels are finished in black and mounted with 120/70 front and 200/60 rear Dunlop Sportmax Q5 tires. Braking is provided by a pair of 330mm drilled rotors with radially mounted Brembo Monobloc four-piston calipers up front as well as a single 300mm drilled disc with a Hayes two-piston caliper at the rear. Front suspension consists of a fully adjustable Öhlins FGR250 inverted 43mm fork while the rear is equipped with a fully adjustable Öhlins monoshock and an aluminum swingarm.

A one-piece handlebar is secured above adjustable billet aluminum triple clamps, while an AIM DL2 data logger positioned just ahead has indicators for oil pressure, engine temperature, and battery amperage as well as a GPS system and lap timers. The data logger shows one test lap that was completed by S&S Cycle however, the bike was not equipped with an odometer, therefore total mileage is unknown.

The liquid-cooled PowerPlus 60-degree 112ci V-twin features an adjustable Maxx Sport ECU, an S&S air intake system, electronic fuel injection with a 78mm throttle body, S&S camshafts, as well as an S&S two-into-one exhaust system.

Power is sent to the rear wheel through a multi-plate wet clutch, a six-speed transmission, and a drive chain.

The bike does not have a title or registration and is being sold on a manufacturer’s certificate of origin.
